citation.article-title: Phenotypic diversity among ruminal isolates of Prevotella ruminicola: proposal of Prevotella brevis sp. nov., Prevotella bryantii sp. nov., and Prevotella albensis sp. nov. and redefinition of Prevotella ruminicola.

p.s: Description of Prevotella bryantii sp. nov.
Prevotella bryantii (bry.an'ti.i. L. gen. n. bryantii, of Bryant, named after Marvin Bryant, an American microbiologist)
A complete description of Prevotella ruminicola subsp. brevis (formerly Bacteroides ruminicola subsp. brevis) biovar 3 (which includes type strain B14) was given by Holdeman et al. (13).
This new species includes strains that resemble strain B14T and have DNA G+C contents between 39 and 43 mol%.
Most strains give clear zones on CMC-containing plates, produce abundant extracellular DNase, and ferment xylose, salicin, arbutin, rhamnose, and inulin but do not ferment N-acetylglucosamine.
The type strain is strain DSM 11371.
